nodes.dialog_text:
You slump against the side of the cage and fall asleep to the mess 
of a ceremony before you.

This goes on for several hours, and eventually you grow weary, your 
eyes grow heavy.

They dance and dance and with every passing minute they get faster
and faster in a dizzying mirage of spectral performance.

Then, with an abrubt bump in the music the monsters start to dance, 
a waltz of sorts if you can even call it that.

Some of the monsters step together and use their bodies to create 
some sort of music, and the rest come together in a big ball.

With that, Grungulus steps back, and turns to it's citizens, letting out 
a screeching cry. Little flowers uproot themselves and are set alight 
into little mimics of candles.
this is halloween tlown, and I am it's maylor. Grungulus.

you are nlot allowed among our lands until you flind a way hlere of 
your own mlerit, but while you're with us you may wlitness our 
celremony.

It comes forward, it's upper face (it has 2?) at the same height as 
you in your cage.

But most impressive of them all, a gargantuous creature of dazzling 
proportions and luscious of lips, it stands out by some sort of flesh 
protrusion coming from it's head in the vague shape of a top hat.

All around the tree is a managerie of freaky freaks of all sorts. A 
few gooey ghosts, a pair of spooky skeletons, an estrangement of 
cackling beasties and fleshy blobs of fun.

You wake up on metal, and you find yourself in a cage hanging from
the branches of tree.
